sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now with me, Sara Green.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Thanks for joining us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Our top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Stalemate at security talks in Brussels as NATO rejects Russia's key demands, but diplomatic efforts continue today in Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Is the party over for UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He's under mounting pressure to resign after admitting he was at a Downing Street party while Britain was in strict lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And Prince Andrew could end up in court this year after a New York judge rejects the British royal's bid to have a civil suit on sexual assault claims against him thrown out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: claims against him thrown out. After four hours of tense talks, the US and NATO have rejected key Russian security demands

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: for easing tensions over Ukraine, but are keeping the door open for future talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Speaking to Euronews, the US.S. deputy secretary of state had a message from Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: REP. ANNE BELL, U.S. Secretary of State for Europe, Anything is possible in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But I will say this. It won't be about diplomacy failing. It will be about President Putin having made a choice that actually I think will bring great, great sorrow to his countrymen and women because there will be great economic costs to Russia if they take this action. I think he knows that. There's enormous solidarity he will have heard this week. So he will know that we will be unified in imposing costs if he makes the wrong choice. I hope he makes the right one." Wendy Sherman told us she didn't expect to get instant answers from Russia this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That her efforts are part of a series of quote critical and important dialogues that will continue Thursday in Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In an interview with Euronews, a firm, NATO's Secretary General said NATO would not be bowing to Russia's demands. NATOs sekretær-general sa at NATO ikke stor russisk militær utbytte. Vi må forstå at Russia er aggressiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia har invadert Ukraina, opplevet en del av Ukraina, Kramia, og fortsetter å kontrollere og destabilisere Est og Ukraina, Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Jens Stoltenberg sa at det fortsatt var en virkelig farge for en armt konflikt i Europa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels. was still a real danger for an armed conflict in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson has issued an apology during a grilling at Wednesday's Prime Minister's Questions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Conservative leader explained that he thought the meeting on the 20th of May 2020 was a work event and spent 25 minutes in the garden before returning to the office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It happened during a time when the country was under strict lockdown regulations against Covid and therefore angered many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mr Speaker, I want to apologise. I have learned enough to know that there were things we simply did not get right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And I must take responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He went on to explain that the garden was an extension of the Downing Street office, but he did acknowledge that he should have done things differently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The opposition leader, Keir Starmer, says it's a worthless apology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Well, there we have it. Leader Keir Starmer says it's a worthless apology. Thank you Mr. Speaker.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Well there we have it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After months of deceit and deception, the pathetic spectacle of a man who's run out of road.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Is he now going to do the decent thing and resign?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However, Boris Johnson made no mention of stepping down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He only reiterated that everyone should wait for the results of the independent inquiry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, a High Court judge says that the UK government's operation of a VIP lane for suppliers of PPE equipment during the pandemic was illegal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: British royal Prince Andrew will face a civil lawsuit in the United States over allegations he sexually assaulted an underage girl.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: A New York judge on Wednesday rejected Andrew's bid to have the case thrown out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Virginia Dufresne is taking the prince to court over accusations he abused her when she was 17 years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: She says she was trafficked by the late convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, a friend of the prince.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Epstein's ex-girlfriend, Jeline Maxwell, also a friend of the prince, was convicted by a US court last month on sex trafficking charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Susan Tehrani has more from New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Really a last ditch effort on the part of Prince Andrew and his lawyers to try to toss this case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: First, it was an attempt to claim that Virginia Joffrey doesn't live in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: She's not a citizen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That didn't go through and for the second time it was this attempt to say that a settlement had been reached between jeffrey epstein and virginia joffrey back in 2009 and perhaps that was a cause to throw this case away it did not work uh the judge today said that in the ruling part of the case it said quote uh this lawsuit alleges discrete incidents of sexual abuse in particular circumstances at three identifiable locations it identifies to whom it attributes that sexual abuse, end of quote. So at this point, Prince Andrew has until July 14th to potentially answer questions under oath. And if a settlement is not reached, the trial will go to court and a jury trial will take place later this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The UK has reported nearly 400 new deaths from Covid. It's the second day in a row that the daily figure has hit an 11-month high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Wednesday's number hasn't been reached since February 24 last year, when 442 deaths were reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The WHO has urged people not to be complacent. While Omicron causes less severe disease than Delta, it remains a dangerous virus, particularly for those who are unvaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Denmark is to offer a fourth coronavirus vaccination to vulnerable citizens as it faces record infection numbers from the Omicron variant. However, the European Union's drug regulator has expressed doubts about the need for a fourth dose and said there was currently no data to support this approach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Switzerland is to halve its quarantine time to five days to tackle its wave of COVID infections that's threatening to derail the economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The reduction comes into effect from today. The government says it's possible because the Omicron variant has a shortened time between infection and transmission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And in France, schools have closed their doors ahead of a nationwide strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Teachers are frustrated with what they say is the constant changing of Covid rules by the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Testing and isolation requirements for potential Covid cases are disrupting classes, making teaching unmanageable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Just as Covid cases hit a daily new record of over 7,000 in Bulgaria, the government is facing a backlash over COVID passes. Hundreds of protesters, organized by the nationalist party Revival, tried to force their way into the building where members of parliament sit. We don't know how long the policemen will be able to hold back the protesters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They are trying to invade the parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A week ago, Bulgarian authorities decided that nobody could enter the parliament building without a Covid certificate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In response, the leader of the nationalist party said he would bring thousands of supporters to disrupt the session.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Some protesters arrived in the capital in specially organized transport from other parts of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We don't want a Covid certificate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It doesn't protect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I've been sick with Covid and I think it's not so dangerous.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Vaccines are useful, but not these ones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Where from?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ruse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: How did you come to Sofia?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: By bus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Did you pay for it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: No, it was paid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The leader, Kustadin Kustadinov, and members of his party have called the vaccines experimental liquids.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: However, it's claimed a third of them possess a COVID certificate and, in fact, have been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Kostadinov was quarantined after being in contact with the Speaker of the Parliament, who tested positive for COVID.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He didn't come to the protest, but it did not stop his supporters from responding to his call to disrupt the proceeding. Several people, including police officers, were injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Among those arrested was one carrying a gun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Stay with us on Euronews now for more on the stories making the news in Europe and beyond.
